summary: ICP dapp scaffolded with a Motoko backend and a React (Vite + Tailwind + shadcn/ui) frontend featuring marketing pages, courses/articles content, Internet Identity auth hooks, and certificate verification UI.
architectural_notes: Frontend uses React + Vite with Tailwind and shadcn/ui component primitives.
Internet Identity authentication is encapsulated in reusable hooks (useInternetIdentity/useActor).
ICP canister configuration included for backend and frontend (canister.yaml + DID bindings).
Build-template includes scripts for pruning/resizing images and a standardized deployment workflow.
Contact form should support sending messages to hackrootorg82@gmail.com, but email delivery will be enabled later; implement UI/layout now with a placeholder/no-op submission handler.
Homepage hero/subtitle area: at the bottom, display only the provided Sanskrit verse (यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य...); no additional text in that bottom verse block.
Home page hero subtitle: remove the English subtitle line and replace it with only the provided Sanskrit shloka text, rendered bold, preserving the blank line/line breaks exactly as provided.
Decision: authentication will use Internet Identity only; do not implement phone-number/password or email/password signup/login flows.
known_issues: Build/network deployment is failing (deployment failed); user requested retry.

existing_features.title: Create a new Gallery page that displays a responsive grid of images.
Populate the Gallery page with a curated set of existing generated images already in the project so the grid has content immediately.
Add routing so the Gallery page is accessible at /gallery.
Add a “Gallery” navigation link in the site header and footer quick links.

Add the uploaded logo image as a static asset in the frontend and use it as the primary brand mark in the site header (replacing the current Shield icon) while preserving the existing site name and tagline text.
Update the site footer brand section to include the same logo next to/above the "Hackroot Organization" brand text, styled consistently with the existing footer typography and spacing.
Add favicon/app icon assets derived from the uploaded logo and update frontend/index.html to reference the favicon so browser tabs display the logo.
Create a reusable, responsive carousel component that supports multiple slides where each slide contains an image and accompanying text content.
Add a text+image carousel section to the Home page using existing generated images as slide backgrounds/illustrations and English user-facing copy.
Add a text+image carousel section to the About page using existing generated images and English user-facing copy.
Extend the courses data model to include a course price and ensure it can be displayed in Indian Rupees (INR) across the UI.
Create a Course Detail page that shows the full details for a selected course, including the course price displayed in INR, and provide a clear way to navigate back to the courses list.
Update the Courses page so the "Enroll Now" button opens the selected course’s detail view, and show the course price in INR in the course card UI.

Ensure the Courses page "Enroll Now" action always navigates to the selected course’s full detail view at /courses/$courseId and that the detail view displays the course price formatted in Indian Rupees (INR).

Update the Course Detail page layout to be fully responsive with a medium-density reading experience and ensure the full course description is always visible (no truncation/clamping or hidden overflow).
Ensure the course description shown on the Courses page cards is not visually hidden/truncated and remains readable across responsive breakpoints.

Update the site "Connect" social icon links to use the provided URLs (YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Telegram) instead of placeholder "#" links wherever the "Connect"/social icons are rendered (including the footer "Connect" section and the Contact page "Follow Us" section).
Update the Contact page "Contact Information" email address to use hackrootorg82@gmail.com, including the visible email text and the mailto: link target.

Keep the "Send us a Message" form as a working layout-only submission (no outbound email sending), and update the user-facing copy so it does not imply that messages are sent to email or that a 24-hour response is guaranteed.

Replace every occurrence of the brand text "cybermidesoace" (including any case/typo variants such as "CyberMindspace") across the frontend with "Hackroot Organization", including visible UI text and HTML metadata (page title/description) where applicable.

Implement automatic scroll-to-top behavior whenever the route changes so that navigating to pages like Home, Courses, Articles, Resources, About, Gallery, Contact (and other site routes) always lands the user at the top of the new page.

Add an enrollment payment flow on the Course Detail page so that when a user clicks the course detail "Enroll Now" button, they are prompted to choose a payment method and complete a simulated payment step before enrollment is confirmed.
Wire the Course Detail page enrollment flow to the backend enrollment methods using the existing actor hook, and reflect enrollment state in the UI (e.g., disable enrollment or show "Enrolled").

Add a dedicated enrollment success view (either a new route or a reusable success card) that can be shown after successful enrollment, including course title, paid amount in INR, and a clear next action.
Add a slim top strip above the existing SiteHeader navigation that displays (a) social media icon links, (b) an email address, (c) a phone number, and (d) the message "Start Your Career With Us !!".

Use the existing site social URLs already used in the footer/contact for the top-strip social icons (YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, Telegram), and do not include placeholder social links (e.g., href="#") in the top strip.
Set the top-strip email address to "hackrootorg82@gmail.com" (consistent with the Contact page) unless an alternate email is explicitly provided later.

Add a cyber-related background video to the Home page hero section (the top hero area on the Home page) so that it appears as a full-bleed background behind the existing hero content (headline, buttons, and animated code lines).

Implement an accessibility/performance fallback for the Home hero background video: when the user prefers reduced motion, or if the video cannot load, display the existing static hero background image instead (keeping the current hero styling and layout).
Add the cyber-themed background video file as a static frontend asset and reference it from the Home page hero (do not serve video through the backend).

Identify the root cause of the current build/network deployment failure and implement the minimal code/config changes required so the project can successfully build and deploy again (frontend + backend).
Add clear, user-actionable error output for deployment failures so that when deployment fails again, logs include the failing step and the underlying error (not just a generic failure message).

Ensure the build/deploy process is resilient to transient network issues by adding a bounded retry strategy to the deployment workflow for network-dependent steps (without changing the app’s runtime behavior).

Update the Articles content data so the additional articles requested by the user are included in the Articles list and can be opened in the Article Detail view. Add each new article to frontend/src/data/articles.ts with a unique slug, English title, preview, full content, author, date, and a valid image path.

If any of the newly added articles require new images, add those image files as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/ (or frontend/public/assets/generated if generated) and reference them via the Article.image field so images load correctly on both the Articles list and Article Detail pages.
Add a floating WhatsApp inquiry/contact button that is always visible across the site as a top-layer (highest z-index) UI element fixed to the bottom-right of the viewport.
Wire the floating WhatsApp inquiry button to open WhatsApp chat in a new tab using the site phone number already shown in the top contact strip (tel:7527050563), using a wa.me link format.
Style the floating WhatsApp inquiry button to match the existing cybersecurity theme (Tailwind + existing theme variables), including hover/focus-visible states and a touch-friendly hit area.
Add the uploaded accreditation banner image (image.png) as a static frontend asset and render a new “We are Accredited by” section on the Home page that displays this image responsively.

Update the Home page hero subtitle text (the paragraph directly under the main hero headline) to use the English line "Unlock the future of digital security with real-world cybersecurity training, ethical hacking, and expert tools." and then display the provided Sanskrit verse directly beneath it with preserved line breaks.

On the Home page hero section (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx), remove the English subtitle line "Unlock the future of digital security with real-world cybersecurity training, ethical hacking, and expert tools." and display only the provided Sanskrit verse in its place, rendered in bold while preserving the existing line breaks/spacing.
Add a new protected User Dashboard page at route "/dashboard" that is only accessible when the user is authenticated via Internet Identity.
Implement a reusable client-side auth guard component for TanStack Router pages that require Internet Identity authentication, and use it to protect the Dashboard page.

Update the site header to support authentication actions using Internet Identity: show a "Log in" button when logged out, show a "Log out" button when logged in, and show a "Dashboard" navigation link only when logged in.
Ensure the login flow results in the user being able to reach the dashboard immediately after successful Internet Identity authentication.
Add basic Dashboard page content using English user-facing text: show a "User Dashboard" heading and display the logged-in user's Principal in a readable format.
